DOC.brief_title: Predictor Early Recovery Urinary Continence After Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy
DOC.detailed_description: Laparoscopic radical prostatectomy ( LRP ) effective treat localized prostate cancer good long-term oncological outcome . Urinary incontinence , bothersome complication negative effect patient 's quality life , remain relevant problem LRP , despite improvement surgical technique . More 80 % patient undergoing radical prostatectomy encounter urinary incontinence immediately catheter removal , bladder condition generally stabilize within two year operation . Among patient undergo LRP , persistent urinary incontinence report 4âˆ’30 % patient , treatment often require . Definite evaluation void function recommend patient prolonged post-prostatectomy urinary incontinence ( PPI ) . To improve quality life LRP , early recovery urinary continence important concern patient . Several study investigate predictive factor early recovery urinary continence prostatectomy , include amount urine loss catheter removal , pelvic floor muscle function , nerve-sparing technique , membranous urethral length loss ratio . Other factor relate early recovery urinary continence include post-operative anatomy low urinary tract , length membranous urethra level vesicourethral junction . However , consensus standard criterion use measure structural change , relationship urodynamic change anatomical morphology remain unclear . In study , investigator study relationship urodynamic parameter bladder neck level LRP , effect early recovery urinary incontinence . This study retrospective analysis . From 2011 2014 , total 48 consecutive patient localize prostatic cancer underwent LRP single medical center two experienced surgeon . Videourodynamic study perform operation ( baseline ) 3 6 month operation . The Ethics Committee hospital approve study write informed consent waive study retrospective analysis . The principle Helsinki Declaration follow throughout study . The urodynamic parameter measure record include first sensation filling ( FSF ) , maximum flow rate ( Qmax ) , detrusor pressure Qmax ( PdetQmax ) , voided volume , cystometric bladder capacity ( CBC ) , bladder compliance , post-void residual ( PVR ) volume , maximal urethral closure pressure ( MUCP ) functional profile length ( FPL ) . The urodynamic parameter compare baseline different time-points LRP . The BN level evaluate retrograde cystography , routinely perform 7 14 day LRP evaluate condition anastomosis . The image obtain anteroposteriorly infuse 100-150 mL contrast solution bladder patient stand position . The distance bladder neck superior margin symphysis pubis ( SMSP ) measure urologist . The bladder neck level grade three-point scale : bladder neck level SMSP mark level 0 , bladder neck level distance le 2 cm SMSP mark level -1 , bladder neck level 2 cm SMSP label level -2 . The patient 's urinary continence status evaluate direct visit via questionnaire follow-up period 3 , 6 , 12 month post-operatively . Patients without urine leakage daily life use one pad per day safety reason without limitation daily activity define `` urinary continent '' . Otherwise , patient define `` urinary incontinent '' . Regaining continence within 3 month LRP consider early recovery urinary continence . The data collect retrospectively chart review . The variable among continent incontinent patient evaluate univariate analysis ( t-test continuous variable Chi-square categorical variable ) . The ANOVA test use compare urodynamic parameter different BN level . Statistical analysis perform use SPSS 20.0 statistical software .
